A concurring opinion in the Supreme Court’s decision on Roe suggests other rights—such as the freedom to decide when you are going to start a family and to make decisions about contraception, IUDs—are at risk.

The Supreme Court took away a constitutional right that has been recognized for half a century from the women of America.

Our daughter will not have the same right to make decisions about her own body as my mother-in-law.
I invite all people to stand together for freedom, self-determination, and for the right to privacy. https://t.co/f3VLjOySml
The Supreme Court decision calls into question other rights that we thought were settled. https://t.co/f80J1SdzKB
This is a health care crisis. https://t.co/gbCUev3r3U

My message to the American people: You have the power to elect leaders who will defend and protect your rights. 

And as the president said, with your vote, you can act. You have the final word. 

So this is not over.

Millions of women in America will go to bed tonight without access to the health care and reproductive health care their mothers and grandmothers had for 50 years.

A constitutional right has been taken from the people of America.

We have taken historic action to elevate this issue and will continue working to protect women.

Our children, nieces, nephews, Godchildren, and grandchildren deserve the future Democrats can build—a future where every American can support their family and feel safe in their homes, churches, and schools.
At every turn, Republican leaders have shown no interest in making progress on the issues that matter most to the American people. https://t.co/o565zhf0mZ

Rescue our nation in the middle of a pandemic.
Protect women and keep their health decisions private.
Protect our most fundamental right: the right to vote.

Growing up, my mother made sure that my sister Maya and I learned about the history of Asian Americans, Native Hawaiians, and Pacific Islanders in our country. 

The National Museum of Asian Pacific American History and Culture will tell the story of our country.

Now, we‘ve seen record job creation, record decline in unemployment, and a record increase in labor participation.

When talking about Roe v. Wade, we need to discuss the right to self-determination: the ability of an individual to make their own decisions about their life and future.
The premise and power of Roe v. Wade is that people should have the right to make decisions about their own bodies.

The American Rescue Plan resulted in: 

—Americans getting vaccinated
—Small businesses staying open
—Schools reopening
—Support for frontline workers
—Parents returning to work

But there's still work ahead to keep delivering for all Americans.

Lives are lost to gun violence on streets across America every day. It’s past time to do something.

Ban assault weapons. Expand background checks. Repeal the liability that protects gun manufacturers.

Let’s get this done.

No 86-year-old should fear for her safety when going to the grocery store.  

No nine-year-old should be afraid to go to school.  

No 18-year-old should be able to buy a weapon of war.  
 
We need to pass commonsense gun safety laws.

There’s a through-line from what happened at Tops Market in Buffalo to what happened in Atlanta, in Orlando, and at the Tree of Life synagogue in Pittsburgh. 

There’s no place for hate in our nation.

We must stand up and say: Enough is enough.
From economic inequality to the climate crisis, our hemisphere faces shared challenges—and we must work together to find solutions. https://t.co/mhRvmNsDeZ

The latest jobs report:

390,000 jobs were added last month. 
Nearly 9 million new jobs have been added since taking office.
Historic rates of small business creation.

There’s still more work to do, but we are seeing a shift from recovery to sustainable growth.

Since President Biden and I took office, our country has seen record job creation, declines in unemployment, and an increase in labor participation. 

Challenges remain, but we are headed in the right direction towards steady and stable economic growth.
We are proud to stand with our unions and our workers.

As California's attorney general, I worked with students, advocates, and other state attorneys general to fight for relief for Corinthian students.

I promised that we would do everything in our power to help them, and finally, that promise has been fulfilled. https://t.co/gyODI8jKiF
We continue to call on Congress to make Roe v. Wade the law, which would protect your right to make decisions about your own body without the government interfering.

Since day one, our position has been clear: We will defend women’s constitutional rights and fight to protect the fundamental right to self-determination.

President @JoeBiden has taken more executive action to combat gun violence than any other president at this point in their administration. 

But we cannot address this alone. 

No more excuses. Thoughts and prayers are important but not enough. We need Congress to act.

Today in America, more than half of children under six are at risk of lead exposure.

The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law will replace lead pipes so our kids can drink clean water.

Without a doubt, gender equality strengthens democracy.

Every person in our nation deserves access to clean water, and every community deserves water security.

With our Action Plan on Global Water Security, we are committed to creating a future in which all people have access to our world’s most precious resource.

Happy Pride!

The fight for LGBTQ+ rights is a fight for civil rights.

Today marks the first day of Pride Month. While we should celebrate how far we’ve come, we must continue standing in solidarity with LGBTQ+ Americans in their ongoing struggle against discrimination and injustice. https://t.co/rAYzvXrTVk

Every day, more than 25 million children ride to and from school on buses that run on diesel fuel.

The investments of the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law are beginning to change that by electrifying our nation’s school bus fleet.

Overturning Roe v. Wade opens the door to restricting the fundamental right to self-determination to live and love. 

This is about our future. About whether we live in a country where the government can interfere in personal decisions.
This is about our future. https://t.co/EaIuGdbmfU

The right to privacy that forms the basis of Roe v. Wade also protects the right to use contraception and the right to marry the person you love. 

Overturning Roe opens the door to restricting those rights.

If Roe v. Wade is overturned, it will be an extreme step backward and a direct assault on the fundamental right to self-determination. 

It represents a threat not just to women but to all Americans.

A harm against any one of us is harm against all of us. 

Hate and violence have no place here in America, and we are all in this together as one nation undivided.

Yesterday in Oklahoma, the state legislature passed a law that would effectively ban abortion from the moment of fertilization. It’s outrageous.

We must elect pro-choice leaders at the local, state, and federal level.

We need you to serve at the highest levels of government and determine our country’s standing in the world.
 
We need you because your perspective—the sum total of your intellect and lived experience—will strengthen our country.

When the right to privacy is attacked, anyone in our country may face a future where the government can interfere in their personal decisions. 

Not just women. Anyone.

How dare Republicans try to deny women their rights and freedoms.

Republican legislators in states across the country are weaponizing the use of Roe v. Wade against women. 

The rights of all Americans are at risk. This is the time to fight for women and our country with everything we have.

The U.S. Supreme Court has confirmed the draft opinion overturning Roe v. Wade is genuine.

Roe v. Wade ensures a woman’s right to choose to have an abortion. It is clear that opponents of Roe want to punish women and take away their rights to make decisions about their bodies.
